page.title: 06PRESTBURY SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: There has been a sewage works at Prestbury for nearly 100 years. It serves Macclesfield, Bollington and surrounding villages. 30 million litres of sewage come into the sewage works in a normal day but if it is a very wet day it increases to 180 million litres. The site covers about half a square kilometre. The cleaned water goes into the River Bollin and the sludge is given free to the farmers to use for fertiliser. 22 people work in the Sewage Plant, Offices and Laboratory. On 12th July, 1985{Heidi Wright, Jane Barratt and } {Debbie Knight}were shown round the Sewage Works by Mr. Piggott. Mr. Piggott said that the workers got used to the smell and they were very happy and healthy working there. Sometimes he gets requests to look for peoples lost false teeth and wedding rings.
